home-title: Be informed on the best way to protect yourself from Coronavirus

symtoms.title: Symptoms
symtoms.descripton: COVID-19 is a respiratory disease and most infected people will develop mild to moderate symptoms and recover without requiring special treatment.  People who have underlying medical conditions and those over 60 years old have a higher risk of developing severe disease and death. People may be sick with the virus for 1 to 14 days before developing symptoms. The most common symptoms of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) are fever, tiredness, and dry cough.
symtoms.symptom_seven: Very few people will report diarrhoea, nausea or a runny nose

prevention.title: Prevention
preventions: Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or clean them with alcohol-based hand rub.
Maintain at least 1 metre distance between you and people coughing or sneezing.
Cover your mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing.
Stay home if you feel unwell.
Refrain from smoking and other activities that weaken the lungs.
Practice physical distancing by avoiding unnecessary travel and staying away from large groups of people.

risk.title: People at higher risk for severe illness
risk.descr: Older adults and people of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be at higher risk for more serious complications from COVID-19.

support.title: Support the fight against COVID-19
support.description: Support the Ministy of Public health in fighting COVID-19 in Cameroon
support.support_descr: Visit the Ministry of Public Health for account information
